meanings.definition: A horizontal timber in a framed partition.
meanings.sent1: The nogging supported the structure of the wall.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter added nogging to strengthen the wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the nogging as a balance beam.
meanings.sent4: The nogging was the backbone of the wall, holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The nogging, like a bridge, connected the two sides of the wall.

meanings.definition: A filling or stuffing, especially for a pie.
meanings.sent1: The delicious nogging in the pie was made of apples and cinnamon.
meanings.sent2: Grandma's secret recipe included a special nogging for the pie filling.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled the nogging all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The nogging in the pie was so flavorful, it stole the show.
meanings.sent5: The warm aroma of the nogging filled the entire house, making everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: To fill in or pack tightly.
meanings.sent1: He had to nogging the suitcase with all his clothes for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The workers had to nogging the boxes carefully to prevent any damage.
meanings.sent3: She tried to nogging all her belongings into the tiny backpack.
meanings.sent4: The students had to nogging their knowledge before the exam.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to nogging the ingredients into the pot to make a delicious stew.
